result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman Rissley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-5TH Or 6TH Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program when the DOC deems it appropriate.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered any vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name to be equipped with the ignition interlock device for 24 months.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Provide DNA sample.
Pay fine of $600.00 plus costs of actions.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds. Balance during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.  
All nonmandatory court cots, fees and surcharges waived by the court.
-Restitution set at zero.

charges.descr: Operating With Prohibited Alcohol Concentration-5TH Or 6TH Offense

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman Rissley

defendant.name: Rissley, Norman
defendant.address: 10585 South Chicago Road, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing. 

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, credit for 3 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Provide DNA sample
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA  to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived by the court.
-Pay fine of $600.00 plus cost of actions.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

Court ordered defendants operation privileges revoked for 24 months with the mandatory reinstatement fee.
Court Ordered any vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name to be equipped with the ignition interlock device for 24 Months. 

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program when the DOC deems it appropriate.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Norman Rissley in court.  Attorney John E Dobogai Iii in court for Norman Rissley.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Norman Rissley in court with attorney John E Dobogai.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requested plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Norman Rissley in court with Attorney John E Dobogai; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316SB.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Norman Rissley in court with attorney John E Dobogai.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency hearing. Defendant has retained counsel. Case needs a preliminary hearing. Defense will waive time limits. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 053772,
Payable Number: 1011837,
Receipt Number: 22RP023124,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Norman Rissley in court, appear in person  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Court is closed 5/20/2022. Next date for preliminary hearing has been changed to 5/23/2022 at 8:30am. Parties are notified.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Norman Rissley in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Norman Rissley in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Norman Rissley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  ADDITIONAL DOCUMENTATION IS NEEDED TO ASSESS ELIGIBILITY.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
